notes: Threat evidence scenarios mapped to EDAMAME Security blog attack narratives. All scenarios are CI-gating.

scenarios.description: Simulate staged HTTPS beaconing after trojanized interview project execution.
scenarios.command:
set -euo pipefail

url='https://api.ipify.org?format=json'

for i in {1..6}; do
  code="$(curl -4 --http1.1 -sS -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}' --max-time 20 "$url" || echo 000)"
  echo "beacon_${i} status=$code"
  sleep 4
done

scenarios.description: Reach the same destination via distinct process identities to validate process-aware allowlist enforcement.
scenarios.command:
set -euo pipefail

url='https://pypi.org/pypi/requests/json'

code="$(curl -4 --http1.1 -sS -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}' --max-time 20 "$url" || echo 000)"
echo "baseline_curl status=$code"

masq="/tmp/masq_curl_$$"
cp "$(command -v curl)" "$masq"
chmod +x "$masq"

code2="$("$masq" -4 --http1.1 -sS -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}' --max-time 20 "$url" || echo 000)"
echo "masquerade_curl status=$code2"

scenarios.description: Emulate sustained bidirectional remote-control style network behavior.
scenarios.command:
set -euo pipefail

url='https://httpbin.org/bytes/2048'

for i in {1..8}; do
  out="$(curl -4 --http1.1 -sS -o /dev/null -w 'status=%{http_code} bytes=%{size_download}' --max-time 20 "$url" || echo 'status=000 bytes=0')"
  echo "control_like_${i} $out"
  sleep 2
done

scenarios.description: Generate rapid multi-target probing behavior as a nearest-neighbor recon approximation.
scenarios.command:
set -euo pipefail

targets=(
  "https://example.com"
  "https://iana.org"
  "https://httpbin.org/get"
  "https://api.ipify.org?format=json"
  "https://httpbin.org/uuid"
)

for round in 1 2 3; do
  for t in "${targets[@]}"; do
    code="$(curl -4 --http1.1 -sS -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}' --max-time 8 "$t" || echo 000)"
    echo "probe round=$round url=$t status=$code"
  done
done

scenarios.description: Approximate CVE-correlated evidence by touching known vulnerability intelligence endpoints.
scenarios.command:
set -euo pipefail

urls=(
  "https://httpbin.org/get?cve=CVE-2024-3094"
  "https://example.com/?cve=CVE-2024-3094"
  "https://httpbin.org/get?cve=CVE-2023-12345"
)

for u in "${urls[@]}"; do
  code="$(curl -4 --http1.1 -sS -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}' --max-time 20 "$u" || echo 000)"
  echo "cve_lookup $u $code"
done
